taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes
resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
textField:
One of the 25th (first quartile), 50th (median), and 75th (third quartile) percentiles: *Quartile*
Removal of a stated percentage (often 20%) of the data points from the two ends of the distribution: *Trimming*
The 25th percentile: *First quartile*
The 75th percentile: *Third quartile*
The dispersion or variability within a data set: *Spread*
The distance of a data point from the mean (Xi – M): *Deviation*
The distance of a data point, or an X value, from the mean, in standard deviation units: *Z score*
Interval from the first to the third quartile, and indicator of the spread of points in a data set: *Interquartile range*
The interval from the lowest to the highest point in a data set: *Range*
The most frequent data value, that requires only nominal scaling: *Mode*
The number of cases or data points in a category or bin: *Frequency*
The region of the X axis where, generally, a data set is found: *Location*
The square of the SD: *Variance*
The value of X below which the stated percentage of data points lie: *Percentile*
The value on the X axis below and above which half of the data points lie. The 50th percentile. It requires only ordinal scaling and is not influenced by how far points are to the left and to the right of this measure: *Median*
The way the data points in a data set are distributed along the X axis: *Distribution*
